Sentence_species: Eudorylaimus (E. antarcticus + bacteria), and (4) Mixed (S. lindsayae + E. antarcticus + bacteria).
Sentence_location: Recent evidence showed that E. antarcticus occupied the omnivore-predator trophic level in Taylor Valley [35]; the presence of multiple trophic levels—from microbes and microbivores to omnivore-predators—indicates that biotic interactions existed in the MDV.

Sentence_species: Eudorylaimus (E. antarcticus + bacteria), and (4) Mixed (S. lindsayae + E. antarcticus + bacteria).
Sentence_location: We aimed to inoculate Scottnema microcosms with S. lindsayae at abundances of 1000 to 2000 per kg dry soil (125 to 250 per microcosm) based on mean abundances found in Taylor Valley soils [8].

Sentence_species: Eudorylaimus (E. antarcticus + bacteria), and (4) Mixed (S. lindsayae + E. antarcticus + bacteria).
Sentence_location: Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.

Sentence_species: Eudorylaimus (E. antarcticus + bacteria), and (4) Mixed (S. lindsayae + E. antarcticus + bacteria).
Sentence_location: This could be due to a number of stresses, including the storage of soils, transferring the nematodes from Hjorth Hill soils to Many Glaciers Pond soil, the stress of picking the nematodes by hand with the eyelash tool, or providing insufficient food sources.

Sentence_location: Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.

Sentence_location: The McMurdo Dry Valleys (MDV), Antarctica, are relatively simple soil ecosystems compared to temperate soils, making them an excellent study system for the trophic relationships of soil.

Sentence_species: This nematode co-occurs with other invertebrates such as the omnivore-predator nematode Eudorylaimus antarcticus, and sometimes with the microbivore nematode Plectus murrayi along with tardigrades and rotifers.
Sentence_location: The McMurdo Dry Valleys (MDV) in Victoria Land, Antarctica, compose the largest ice-free area on the continent [6].

Sentence_species: This nematode co-occurs with other invertebrates such as the omnivore-predator nematode Eudorylaimus antarcticus, and sometimes with the microbivore nematode Plectus murrayi along with tardigrades and rotifers.
Sentence_location: Recent evidence showed that E. antarcticus occupied the omnivore-predator trophic level in Taylor Valley [35]; the presence of multiple trophic levels—from microbes and microbivores to omnivore-predators—indicates that biotic interactions existed in the MDV.

Sentence_species: This nematode co-occurs with other invertebrates such as the omnivore-predator nematode Eudorylaimus antarcticus, and sometimes with the microbivore nematode Plectus murrayi along with tardigrades and rotifers.
Sentence_location: We aimed to inoculate Scottnema microcosms with S. lindsayae at abundances of 1000 to 2000 per kg dry soil (125 to 250 per microcosm) based on mean abundances found in Taylor Valley soils [8].

Sentence_species: This nematode co-occurs with other invertebrates such as the omnivore-predator nematode Eudorylaimus antarcticus, and sometimes with the microbivore nematode Plectus murrayi along with tardigrades and rotifers.
Sentence_location: Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.

Sentence_species: This nematode co-occurs with other invertebrates such as the omnivore-predator nematode Eudorylaimus antarcticus, and sometimes with the microbivore nematode Plectus murrayi along with tardigrades and rotifers.
Sentence_location: This could be due to a number of stresses, including the storage of soils, transferring the nematodes from Hjorth Hill soils to Many Glaciers Pond soil, the stress of picking the nematodes by hand with the eyelash tool, or providing insufficient food sources.

Sentence_location: Recent evidence showed that E. antarcticus occupied the omnivore-predator trophic level in Taylor Valley [35]; the presence of multiple trophic levels—from microbes and microbivores to omnivore-predators—indicates that biotic interactions existed in the MDV.

Sentence_location: Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.

Sentence_location: We aimed to inoculate Scottnema microcosms with S. lindsayae at abundances of 1000 to 2000 per kg dry soil (125 to 250 per microcosm) based on mean abundances found in Taylor Valley soils [8].

Sentence_location: Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.

Sentence_species: To test these questions we designed a full-factorial laboratory microcosm experiment (4 community x 2 moisture x 2 salinity treatments) to test the effects of soil salinity, moisture, and their interaction on bacteria, S. lindsayae, and E. antarcticus at four levels of community diversity (bacteria only, bacteria + S. lindsayae only, bacteria + E. antarcticus only, and bacteria + both nematode species).
Sentence_location: The McMurdo Dry Valleys (MDV), Antarctica, are relatively simple soil ecosystems compared to temperate soils, making them an excellent study system for the trophic relationships of soil.

Sentence_species: To test these questions we designed a full-factorial laboratory microcosm experiment (4 community x 2 moisture x 2 salinity treatments) to test the effects of soil salinity, moisture, and their interaction on bacteria, S. lindsayae, and E. antarcticus at four levels of community diversity (bacteria only, bacteria + S. lindsayae only, bacteria + E. antarcticus only, and bacteria + both nematode species).
Sentence_location: The McMurdo Dry Valleys (MDV) in Victoria Land, Antarctica, compose the largest ice-free area on the continent [6].

Sentence_location: Recent evidence showed that E. antarcticus occupied the omnivore-predator trophic level in Taylor Valley [35]; the presence of multiple trophic levels—from microbes and microbivores to omnivore-predators—indicates that biotic interactions existed in the MDV.

Sentence_location: Recent evidence showed that E. antarcticus occupied the omnivore-predator trophic level in Taylor Valley [35]; the presence of multiple trophic levels—from microbes and microbivores to omnivore-predators—indicates that biotic interactions existed in the MDV.

Sentence_location: The McMurdo Dry Valleys (MDV), Antarctica, are relatively simple soil ecosystems compared to temperate soils, making them an excellent study system for the trophic relationships of soil.

Sentence_location: The McMurdo Dry Valleys (MDV) in Victoria Land, Antarctica, compose the largest ice-free area on the continent [6].

Sentence_species: To test these questions we designed a full-factorial laboratory microcosm experiment (4 community x 2 moisture x 2 salinity treatments) to test the effects of soil salinity, moisture, and their interaction on bacteria, S. lindsayae, and E. antarcticus at four levels of community diversity (bacteria only, bacteria + S. lindsayae only, bacteria + E. antarcticus only, and bacteria + both nematode species).
Sentence_location: Recent evidence showed that E. antarcticus occupied the omnivore-predator trophic level in Taylor Valley [35]; the presence of multiple trophic levels—from microbes and microbivores to omnivore-predators—indicates that biotic interactions existed in the MDV.

Sentence_species: To test these questions we designed a full-factorial laboratory microcosm experiment (4 community x 2 moisture x 2 salinity treatments) to test the effects of soil salinity, moisture, and their interaction on bacteria, S. lindsayae, and E. antarcticus at four levels of community diversity (bacteria only, bacteria + S. lindsayae only, bacteria + E. antarcticus only, and bacteria + both nematode species).
Sentence_location: We aimed to inoculate Scottnema microcosms with S. lindsayae at abundances of 1000 to 2000 per kg dry soil (125 to 250 per microcosm) based on mean abundances found in Taylor Valley soils [8].

Sentence_species: To test these questions we designed a full-factorial laboratory microcosm experiment (4 community x 2 moisture x 2 salinity treatments) to test the effects of soil salinity, moisture, and their interaction on bacteria, S. lindsayae, and E. antarcticus at four levels of community diversity (bacteria only, bacteria + S. lindsayae only, bacteria + E. antarcticus only, and bacteria + both nematode species).
Sentence_location: Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.

Sentence_species: To test these questions we designed a full-factorial laboratory microcosm experiment (4 community x 2 moisture x 2 salinity treatments) to test the effects of soil salinity, moisture, and their interaction on bacteria, S. lindsayae, and E. antarcticus at four levels of community diversity (bacteria only, bacteria + S. lindsayae only, bacteria + E. antarcticus only, and bacteria + both nematode species).
Sentence_location: This could be due to a number of stresses, including the storage of soils, transferring the nematodes from Hjorth Hill soils to Many Glaciers Pond soil, the stress of picking the nematodes by hand with the eyelash tool, or providing insufficient food sources.

Sentence_location: The McMurdo Dry Valleys (MDV) in Victoria Land, Antarctica, compose the largest ice-free area on the continent [6].

Sentence_location: Recent evidence showed that E. antarcticus occupied the omnivore-predator trophic level in Taylor Valley [35]; the presence of multiple trophic levels—from microbes and microbivores to omnivore-predators—indicates that biotic interactions existed in the MDV.

Sentence_location: We aimed to inoculate Scottnema microcosms with S. lindsayae at abundances of 1000 to 2000 per kg dry soil (125 to 250 per microcosm) based on mean abundances found in Taylor Valley soils [8].

Sentence_location: Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.

Sentence_species: We hypothesized that (1) elevated moisture would have a positive effect on soil bacteria and E. antarcticus, but a negative effect on S. lindsayae, (2) elevated salinity would negatively impact all biota, and (3) the magnitude of Soil Syst.
Sentence_location: Recent evidence showed that E. antarcticus occupied the omnivore-predator trophic level in Taylor Valley [35]; the presence of multiple trophic levels—from microbes and microbivores to omnivore-predators—indicates that biotic interactions existed in the MDV.

Sentence_species: We hypothesized that (1) elevated moisture would have a positive effect on soil bacteria and E. antarcticus, but a negative effect on S. lindsayae, (2) elevated salinity would negatively impact all biota, and (3) the magnitude of Soil Syst.
Sentence_location: We aimed to inoculate Scottnema microcosms with S. lindsayae at abundances of 1000 to 2000 per kg dry soil (125 to 250 per microcosm) based on mean abundances found in Taylor Valley soils [8].

Sentence_species: We hypothesized that (1) elevated moisture would have a positive effect on soil bacteria and E. antarcticus, but a negative effect on S. lindsayae, (2) elevated salinity would negatively impact all biota, and (3) the magnitude of Soil Syst.
Sentence_location: Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.

Sentence_species: We hypothesized that (1) elevated moisture would have a positive effect on soil bacteria and E. antarcticus, but a negative effect on S. lindsayae, (2) elevated salinity would negatively impact all biota, and (3) the magnitude of Soil Syst.
Sentence_location: This could be due to a number of stresses, including the storage of soils, transferring the nematodes from Hjorth Hill soils to Many Glaciers Pond soil, the stress of picking the nematodes by hand with the eyelash tool, or providing insufficient food sources.

Sentence_location: The McMurdo Dry Valleys (MDV), Antarctica, are relatively simple soil ecosystems compared to temperate soils, making them an excellent study system for the trophic relationships of soil.

Sentence_species: Community treatments were Bacteria only (control), Scottnema (bacteria + S. lindsayae), Eudorylaimus (bacteria + E. antarcticus), and Mixed (bacteria + S. lindsayae and E. antarcticus).
Sentence_location: The McMurdo Dry Valleys (MDV) in Victoria Land, Antarctica, compose the largest ice-free area on the continent [6].

Sentence_species: Community treatments were Bacteria only (control), Scottnema (bacteria + S. lindsayae), Eudorylaimus (bacteria + E. antarcticus), and Mixed (bacteria + S. lindsayae and E. antarcticus).
Sentence_location: Recent evidence showed that E. antarcticus occupied the omnivore-predator trophic level in Taylor Valley [35]; the presence of multiple trophic levels—from microbes and microbivores to omnivore-predators—indicates that biotic interactions existed in the MDV.

Sentence_species: Community treatments were Bacteria only (control), Scottnema (bacteria + S. lindsayae), Eudorylaimus (bacteria + E. antarcticus), and Mixed (bacteria + S. lindsayae and E. antarcticus).
Sentence_location: We aimed to inoculate Scottnema microcosms with S. lindsayae at abundances of 1000 to 2000 per kg dry soil (125 to 250 per microcosm) based on mean abundances found in Taylor Valley soils [8].

Sentence_species: Community treatments were Bacteria only (control), Scottnema (bacteria + S. lindsayae), Eudorylaimus (bacteria + E. antarcticus), and Mixed (bacteria + S. lindsayae and E. antarcticus).
Sentence_location: Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.

Sentence_species: Community treatments were Bacteria only (control), Scottnema (bacteria + S. lindsayae), Eudorylaimus (bacteria + E. antarcticus), and Mixed (bacteria + S. lindsayae and E. antarcticus).
Sentence_location: This could be due to a number of stresses, including the storage of soils, transferring the nematodes from Hjorth Hill soils to Many Glaciers Pond soil, the stress of picking the nematodes by hand with the eyelash tool, or providing insufficient food sources.

Sentence_location: The McMurdo Dry Valleys (MDV), Antarctica, are relatively simple soil ecosystems compared to temperate soils, making them an excellent study system for the trophic relationships of soil.

Sentence_species: Community treatments were Bacteria only (control), Scottnema (bacteria + S. lindsayae), Eudorylaimus (bacteria + E. antarcticus), and Mixed (bacteria + S. lindsayae and E. antarcticus).
Sentence_location: The McMurdo Dry Valleys (MDV) in Victoria Land, Antarctica, compose the largest ice-free area on the continent [6].

Sentence_species: Community treatments were Bacteria only (control), Scottnema (bacteria + S. lindsayae), Eudorylaimus (bacteria + E. antarcticus), and Mixed (bacteria + S. lindsayae and E. antarcticus).
Sentence_location: Recent evidence showed that E. antarcticus occupied the omnivore-predator trophic level in Taylor Valley [35]; the presence of multiple trophic levels—from microbes and microbivores to omnivore-predators—indicates that biotic interactions existed in the MDV.

Sentence_species: Community treatments were Bacteria only (control), Scottnema (bacteria + S. lindsayae), Eudorylaimus (bacteria + E. antarcticus), and Mixed (bacteria + S. lindsayae and E. antarcticus).
Sentence_location: We aimed to inoculate Scottnema microcosms with S. lindsayae at abundances of 1000 to 2000 per kg dry soil (125 to 250 per microcosm) based on mean abundances found in Taylor Valley soils [8].

Sentence_species: Community treatments were Bacteria only (control), Scottnema (bacteria + S. lindsayae), Eudorylaimus (bacteria + E. antarcticus), and Mixed (bacteria + S. lindsayae and E. antarcticus).
Sentence_location: Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.

Sentence_species: Community treatments were Bacteria only (control), Scottnema (bacteria + S. lindsayae), Eudorylaimus (bacteria + E. antarcticus), and Mixed (bacteria + S. lindsayae and E. antarcticus).
Sentence_location: This could be due to a number of stresses, including the storage of soils, transferring the nematodes from Hjorth Hill soils to Many Glaciers Pond soil, the stress of picking the nematodes by hand with the eyelash tool, or providing insufficient food sources.

Sentence_location: Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.

Sentence_location: This could be due to a number of stresses, including the storage of soils, transferring the nematodes from Hjorth Hill soils to Many Glaciers Pond soil, the stress of picking the nematodes by hand with the eyelash tool, or providing insufficient food sources.

Sentence_location: The McMurdo Dry Valleys (MDV), Antarctica, are relatively simple soil ecosystems compared to temperate soils, making them an excellent study system for the trophic relationships of soil.

Sentence_location: The McMurdo Dry Valleys (MDV) in Victoria Land, Antarctica, compose the largest ice-free area on the continent [6].

Sentence_species: Community treatments were Bacteria only (control), Scottnema (bacteria + S. lindsayae), Eudorylaimus (bacteria + E. antarcticus), and Mixed (bacteria + S. lindsayae and E. antarcticus).
Sentence_location: Recent evidence showed that E. antarcticus occupied the omnivore-predator trophic level in Taylor Valley [35]; the presence of multiple trophic levels—from microbes and microbivores to omnivore-predators—indicates that biotic interactions existed in the MDV.

Sentence_species: Community treatments were Bacteria only (control), Scottnema (bacteria + S. lindsayae), Eudorylaimus (bacteria + E. antarcticus), and Mixed (bacteria + S. lindsayae and E. antarcticus).
Sentence_location: We aimed to inoculate Scottnema microcosms with S. lindsayae at abundances of 1000 to 2000 per kg dry soil (125 to 250 per microcosm) based on mean abundances found in Taylor Valley soils [8].

Sentence_species: Community treatments were Bacteria only (control), Scottnema (bacteria + S. lindsayae), Eudorylaimus (bacteria + E. antarcticus), and Mixed (bacteria + S. lindsayae and E. antarcticus).
Sentence_location: Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.

Sentence_species: Community treatments were Bacteria only (control), Scottnema (bacteria + S. lindsayae), Eudorylaimus (bacteria + E. antarcticus), and Mixed (bacteria + S. lindsayae and E. antarcticus).
Sentence_location: This could be due to a number of stresses, including the storage of soils, transferring the nematodes from Hjorth Hill soils to Many Glaciers Pond soil, the stress of picking the nematodes by hand with the eyelash tool, or providing insufficient food sources.

Sentence_location: We aimed to inoculate Scottnema microcosms with S. lindsayae at abundances of 1000 to 2000 per kg dry soil (125 to 250 per microcosm) based on mean abundances found in Taylor Valley soils [8].

Sentence_location: Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.

Sentence_location: The McMurdo Dry Valleys (MDV), Antarctica, are relatively simple soil ecosystems compared to temperate soils, making them an excellent study system for the trophic relationships of soil.

Sentence_location: The McMurdo Dry Valleys (MDV) in Victoria Land, Antarctica, compose the largest ice-free area on the continent [6].

Sentence_location: Recent evidence showed that E. antarcticus occupied the omnivore-predator trophic level in Taylor Valley [35]; the presence of multiple trophic levels—from microbes and microbivores to omnivore-predators—indicates that biotic interactions existed in the MDV.

Sentence_location: We aimed to inoculate Scottnema microcosms with S. lindsayae at abundances of 1000 to 2000 per kg dry soil (125 to 250 per microcosm) based on mean abundances found in Taylor Valley soils [8].

Sentence_species: Specifically, bacterial abundance, S. lindsayae total abundance, E. antarcticus total abundance, and S. lindsayae juveniles, S. lindsayae adults, S. lindsayae females, and S. lindsayae males were assessed with F tests, followed by post hoc tests (Tukey HSD), to confirm significant effects (p < 0.05).
Sentence_location: The McMurdo Dry Valleys (MDV), Antarctica, are relatively simple soil ecosystems compared to temperate soils, making them an excellent study system for the trophic relationships of soil.

Sentence_species: Specifically, bacterial abundance, S. lindsayae total abundance, E. antarcticus total abundance, and S. lindsayae juveniles, S. lindsayae adults, S. lindsayae females, and S. lindsayae males were assessed with F tests, followed by post hoc tests (Tukey HSD), to confirm significant effects (p < 0.05).
Sentence_location: The McMurdo Dry Valleys (MDV) in Victoria Land, Antarctica, compose the largest ice-free area on the continent [6].

Sentence_species: Specifically, bacterial abundance, S. lindsayae total abundance, E. antarcticus total abundance, and S. lindsayae juveniles, S. lindsayae adults, S. lindsayae females, and S. lindsayae males were assessed with F tests, followed by post hoc tests (Tukey HSD), to confirm significant effects (p < 0.05).
Sentence_location: Recent evidence showed that E. antarcticus occupied the omnivore-predator trophic level in Taylor Valley [35]; the presence of multiple trophic levels—from microbes and microbivores to omnivore-predators—indicates that biotic interactions existed in the MDV.

Sentence_species: Specifically, bacterial abundance, S. lindsayae total abundance, E. antarcticus total abundance, and S. lindsayae juveniles, S. lindsayae adults, S. lindsayae females, and S. lindsayae males were assessed with F tests, followed by post hoc tests (Tukey HSD), to confirm significant effects (p < 0.05).
Sentence_location: We aimed to inoculate Scottnema microcosms with S. lindsayae at abundances of 1000 to 2000 per kg dry soil (125 to 250 per microcosm) based on mean abundances found in Taylor Valley soils [8].

Sentence_location: Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.

Sentence_species: Specifically, bacterial abundance, S. lindsayae total abundance, E. antarcticus total abundance, and S. lindsayae juveniles, S. lindsayae adults, S. lindsayae females, and S. lindsayae males were assessed with F tests, followed by post hoc tests (Tukey HSD), to confirm significant effects (p < 0.05).
Sentence_location: This could be due to a number of stresses, including the storage of soils, transferring the nematodes from Hjorth Hill soils to Many Glaciers Pond soil, the stress of picking the nematodes by hand with the eyelash tool, or providing insufficient food sources.

Sentence_location: Recent evidence showed that E. antarcticus occupied the omnivore-predator trophic level in Taylor Valley [35]; the presence of multiple trophic levels—from microbes and microbivores to omnivore-predators—indicates that biotic interactions existed in the MDV.

Sentence_location: We aimed to inoculate Scottnema microcosms with S. lindsayae at abundances of 1000 to 2000 per kg dry soil (125 to 250 per microcosm) based on mean abundances found in Taylor Valley soils [8].

Sentence_location: Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.

Sentence_location: This could be due to a number of stresses, including the storage of soils, transferring the nematodes from Hjorth Hill soils to Many Glaciers Pond soil, the stress of picking the nematodes by hand with the eyelash tool, or providing insufficient food sources.

Sentence_location: Recent evidence showed that E. antarcticus occupied the omnivore-predator trophic level in Taylor Valley [35]; the presence of multiple trophic levels—from microbes and microbivores to omnivore-predators—indicates that biotic interactions existed in the MDV.

Sentence_species: Specifically, bacterial abundance, S. lindsayae total abundance, E. antarcticus total abundance, and S. lindsayae juveniles, S. lindsayae adults, S. lindsayae females, and S. lindsayae males were assessed with F tests, followed by post hoc tests (Tukey HSD), to confirm significant effects (p < 0.05).
Sentence_location: We aimed to inoculate Scottnema microcosms with S. lindsayae at abundances of 1000 to 2000 per kg dry soil (125 to 250 per microcosm) based on mean abundances found in Taylor Valley soils [8].

Sentence_location: Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.

Sentence_species: Specifically, bacterial abundance, S. lindsayae total abundance, E. antarcticus total abundance, and S. lindsayae juveniles, S. lindsayae adults, S. lindsayae females, and S. lindsayae males were assessed with F tests, followed by post hoc tests (Tukey HSD), to confirm significant effects (p < 0.05).
Sentence_location: This could be due to a number of stresses, including the storage of soils, transferring the nematodes from Hjorth Hill soils to Many Glaciers Pond soil, the stress of picking the nematodes by hand with the eyelash tool, or providing insufficient food sources.

Sentence_location: Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.

Sentence_location: We aimed to inoculate Scottnema microcosms with S. lindsayae at abundances of 1000 to 2000 per kg dry soil (125 to 250 per microcosm) based on mean abundances found in Taylor Valley soils [8].

Sentence_location: Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.

Sentence_species: Effects of community (C), moisture (M), and salinity (S) treatments on Eudorylaimus total abundance, Scottnema total abundance, Scottnema adults, Scottnema juveniles, Scottnema females, Scottnema males, and total bacterial cells (d.f. = degrees of freedom).
Sentence_location: We aimed to inoculate Scottnema microcosms with S. lindsayae at abundances of 1000 to 2000 per kg dry soil (125 to 250 per microcosm) based on mean abundances found in Taylor Valley soils [8].

Sentence_location: Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.

Sentence_location: This could be due to a number of stresses, including the storage of soils, transferring the nematodes from Hjorth Hill soils to Many Glaciers Pond soil, the stress of picking the nematodes by hand with the eyelash tool, or providing insufficient food sources.

Sentence_location: Recent evidence showed that E. antarcticus occupied the omnivore-predator trophic level in Taylor Valley [35]; the presence of multiple trophic levels—from microbes and microbivores to omnivore-predators—indicates that biotic interactions existed in the MDV.

Sentence_species: Effects of community (C), moisture (M), and salinity (S) treatments on Eudorylaimus total abundance, Scottnema total abundance, Scottnema adults, Scottnema juveniles, Scottnema females, Scottnema males, and total bacterial cells (d.f. = degrees of freedom).
Sentence_location: We aimed to inoculate Scottnema microcosms with S. lindsayae at abundances of 1000 to 2000 per kg dry soil (125 to 250 per microcosm) based on mean abundances found in Taylor Valley soils [8].

Sentence_location: Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.

Sentence_species: Effects of community (C), moisture (M), and salinity (S) treatments on Eudorylaimus total abundance, Scottnema total abundance, Scottnema adults, Scottnema juveniles, Scottnema females, Scottnema males, and total bacterial cells (d.f. = degrees of freedom).
Sentence_location: This could be due to a number of stresses, including the storage of soils, transferring the nematodes from Hjorth Hill soils to Many Glaciers Pond soil, the stress of picking the nematodes by hand with the eyelash tool, or providing insufficient food sources.

Sentence_location: The McMurdo Dry Valleys (MDV), Antarctica, are relatively simple soil ecosystems compared to temperate soils, making them an excellent study system for the trophic relationships of soil.

Sentence_species: Effect d.f. F p Effect d.f. F p Eudorylaimus total abundance Scottnema total abundance C 1.32 19.89 <0.0001 C 1.31 2.02 0.165 M 1.32 0.29 0.597
Sentence_location: The McMurdo Dry Valleys (MDV) in Victoria Land, Antarctica, compose the largest ice-free area on the continent [6].

Sentence_species: Effect d.f. F p Effect d.f. F p Eudorylaimus total abundance Scottnema total abundance C 1.32 19.89 <0.0001 C 1.31 2.02 0.165 M 1.32 0.29 0.597
Sentence_location: Recent evidence showed that E. antarcticus occupied the omnivore-predator trophic level in Taylor Valley [35]; the presence of multiple trophic levels—from microbes and microbivores to omnivore-predators—indicates that biotic interactions existed in the MDV.

Sentence_species: Effect d.f. F p Effect d.f. F p Eudorylaimus total abundance Scottnema total abundance C 1.32 19.89 <0.0001 C 1.31 2.02 0.165 M 1.32 0.29 0.597
Sentence_location: We aimed to inoculate Scottnema microcosms with S. lindsayae at abundances of 1000 to 2000 per kg dry soil (125 to 250 per microcosm) based on mean abundances found in Taylor Valley soils [8].

Sentence_species: Effect d.f. F p Effect d.f. F p Eudorylaimus total abundance Scottnema total abundance C 1.32 19.89 <0.0001 C 1.31 2.02 0.165 M 1.32 0.29 0.597
Sentence_location: Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.

Sentence_species: Effect d.f. F p Effect d.f. F p Eudorylaimus total abundance Scottnema total abundance C 1.32 19.89 <0.0001 C 1.31 2.02 0.165 M 1.32 0.29 0.597
Sentence_location: This could be due to a number of stresses, including the storage of soils, transferring the nematodes from Hjorth Hill soils to Many Glaciers Pond soil, the stress of picking the nematodes by hand with the eyelash tool, or providing insufficient food sources.

Sentence_species: Effect d.f. F p Effect d.f. F p Eudorylaimus total abundance Scottnema total abundance C 1.32 19.89 <0.0001 C 1.31 2.02 0.165 M 1.32 0.29 0.597
Sentence_location: We would like to acknowledge the Crary Laboratory staff and PHI helicopters whose assistance with lab and fieldwork in Antarctica helped make this study possible.

The McMurdo Dry Valleys (MDV), Antarctica, are relatively simple soil ecosystems compared to temperate soils, making them an excellent study system for the trophic relationships of soil.
The McMurdo Dry Valleys (MDV) in Victoria Land, Antarctica, compose the largest ice-free area on the continent [6].

Recent evidence showed that E. antarcticus occupied the omnivore-predator trophic level in Taylor Valley [35]; the presence of multiple trophic levels—from microbes and microbivores to omnivore-predators—indicates that biotic interactions existed in the MDV.
We aimed to inoculate Scottnema microcosms with S. lindsayae at abundances of 1000 to 2000 per kg dry soil (125 to 250 per microcosm) based on mean abundances found in Taylor Valley soils [8].

Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.

This could be due to a number of stresses, including the storage of soils, transferring the nematodes from Hjorth Hill soils to Many Glaciers Pond soil, the stress of picking the nematodes by hand with the eyelash tool, or providing insufficient food sources.
We would like to acknowledge the Crary Laboratory staff and PHI helicopters whose assistance with lab and fieldwork in Antarctica helped make this study possible.

Sentence_species: Eudorylaimus antarcticus did not survive in most microcosms (<1%).
Sentence_location: The McMurdo Dry Valleys (MDV), Antarctica, are relatively simple soil ecosystems compared to temperate soils, making them an excellent study system for the trophic relationships of soil.

Sentence_species: Eudorylaimus antarcticus did not survive in most microcosms (<1%).
Sentence_location: The McMurdo Dry Valleys (MDV) in Victoria Land, Antarctica, compose the largest ice-free area on the continent [6].

Sentence_species: Eudorylaimus antarcticus did not survive in most microcosms (<1%).
Sentence_location: Recent evidence showed that E. antarcticus occupied the omnivore-predator trophic level in Taylor Valley [35]; the presence of multiple trophic levels—from microbes and microbivores to omnivore-predators—indicates that biotic interactions existed in the MDV.

Sentence_species: Eudorylaimus antarcticus did not survive in most microcosms (<1%).
Sentence_location: We aimed to inoculate Scottnema microcosms with S. lindsayae at abundances of 1000 to 2000 per kg dry soil (125 to 250 per microcosm) based on mean abundances found in Taylor Valley soils [8].

Sentence_species: Eudorylaimus antarcticus did not survive in most microcosms (<1%).
Sentence_location: Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.

Sentence_species: Eudorylaimus antarcticus did not survive in most microcosms (<1%).
Sentence_location: This could be due to a number of stresses, including the storage of soils, transferring the nematodes from Hjorth Hill soils to Many Glaciers Pond soil, the stress of picking the nematodes by hand with the eyelash tool, or providing insufficient food sources.

Sentence_species: Eudorylaimus antarcticus did not survive in most microcosms (<1%).
Sentence_location: We would like to acknowledge the Crary Laboratory staff and PHI helicopters whose assistance with lab and fieldwork in Antarctica helped make this study possible.

Sentence_location: Recent evidence showed that E. antarcticus occupied the omnivore-predator trophic level in Taylor Valley [35]; the presence of multiple trophic levels—from microbes and microbivores to omnivore-predators—indicates that biotic interactions existed in the MDV.

Sentence_location: Recent evidence showed that E. antarcticus occupied the omnivore-predator trophic level in Taylor Valley [35]; the presence of multiple trophic levels—from microbes and microbivores to omnivore-predators—indicates that biotic interactions existed in the MDV.

Sentence_location: We aimed to inoculate Scottnema microcosms with S. lindsayae at abundances of 1000 to 2000 per kg dry soil (125 to 250 per microcosm) based on mean abundances found in Taylor Valley soils [8].

Sentence_species: Linear relationship between bacteria and S. lindsayae abundance by salinity treatment (Control and High).

Sentence_location: We aimed to inoculate Scottnema microcosms with S. lindsayae at abundances of 1000 to 2000 per kg dry soil (125 to 250 per microcosm) based on mean abundances found in Taylor Valley soils [8].

Sentence_location: Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.

Sentence_location: Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.

Sentence_location: This could be due to a number of stresses, including the storage of soils, transferring the nematodes from Hjorth Hill soils to Many Glaciers Pond soil, the stress of picking the nematodes by hand with the eyelash tool, or providing insufficient food sources.

Sentence_location: Recent evidence showed that E. antarcticus occupied the omnivore-predator trophic level in Taylor Valley [35]; the presence of multiple trophic levels—from microbes and microbivores to omnivore-predators—indicates that biotic interactions existed in the MDV.

Sentence_location: We aimed to inoculate Scottnema microcosms with S. lindsayae at abundances of 1000 to 2000 per kg dry soil (125 to 250 per microcosm) based on mean abundances found in Taylor Valley soils [8].

Sentence_species: Discussion We hypothesized that elevated soil moisture would have a positive effect on soil microbes and E. antarcticus and a negative effect on S. lindsayae, but we found that moisture had no effect on bacteria and a negative effect on S. lindsayae adults only.
Sentence_location: Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.

Sentence_species: Discussion We hypothesized that elevated soil moisture would have a positive effect on soil microbes and E. antarcticus and a negative effect on S. lindsayae, but we found that moisture had no effect on bacteria and a negative effect on S. lindsayae adults only.
Sentence_location: This could be due to a number of stresses, including the storage of soils, transferring the nematodes from Hjorth Hill soils to Many Glaciers Pond soil, the stress of picking the nematodes by hand with the eyelash tool, or providing insufficient food sources.

Sentence_species: Moisture has been shown to have a negative impact in field studies on dry-soil adapted S. lindsayae (e.g., [22,23,55]), but these effects either occurred with an extreme flooding event when soil became saturated [22] or over a decade, when populations declined steadily [23].
Sentence_location: The McMurdo Dry Valleys (MDV), Antarctica, are relatively simple soil ecosystems compared to temperate soils, making them an excellent study system for the trophic relationships of soil.

Sentence_location: The McMurdo Dry Valleys (MDV), Antarctica, are relatively simple soil ecosystems compared to temperate soils, making them an excellent study system for the trophic relationships of soil.

Sentence_location: Recent evidence showed that E. antarcticus occupied the omnivore-predator trophic level in Taylor Valley [35]; the presence of multiple trophic levels—from microbes and microbivores to omnivore-predators—indicates that biotic interactions existed in the MDV.

Sentence_location: We aimed to inoculate Scottnema microcosms with S. lindsayae at abundances of 1000 to 2000 per kg dry soil (125 to 250 per microcosm) based on mean abundances found in Taylor Valley soils [8].

Sentence_location: Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.

Sentence_location: Recent evidence showed that E. antarcticus occupied the omnivore-predator trophic level in Taylor Valley [35]; the presence of multiple trophic levels—from microbes and microbivores to omnivore-predators—indicates that biotic interactions existed in the MDV.

Sentence_location: We aimed to inoculate Scottnema microcosms with S. lindsayae at abundances of 1000 to 2000 per kg dry soil (125 to 250 per microcosm) based on mean abundances found in Taylor Valley soils [8].

Sentence_location: Recent evidence showed that E. antarcticus occupied the omnivore-predator trophic level in Taylor Valley [35]; the presence of multiple trophic levels—from microbes and microbivores to omnivore-predators—indicates that biotic interactions existed in the MDV.

Sentence_location: We aimed to inoculate Scottnema microcosms with S. lindsayae at abundances of 1000 to 2000 per kg dry soil (125 to 250 per microcosm) based on mean abundances found in Taylor Valley soils [8].

Sentence_location: Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.

Sentence_location: Recent evidence showed that E. antarcticus occupied the omnivore-predator trophic level in Taylor Valley [35]; the presence of multiple trophic levels—from microbes and microbivores to omnivore-predators—indicates that biotic interactions existed in the MDV.

Sentence_location: We aimed to inoculate Scottnema microcosms with S. lindsayae at abundances of 1000 to 2000 per kg dry soil (125 to 250 per microcosm) based on mean abundances found in Taylor Valley soils [8].

Sentence_location: Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.

Sentence_location: Recent evidence showed that E. antarcticus occupied the omnivore-predator trophic level in Taylor Valley [35]; the presence of multiple trophic levels—from microbes and microbivores to omnivore-predators—indicates that biotic interactions existed in the MDV.

Sentence_location: Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.

Sentence_location: The McMurdo Dry Valleys (MDV), Antarctica, are relatively simple soil ecosystems compared to temperate soils, making them an excellent study system for the trophic relationships of soil.

Sentence_species: [CrossRef] Shaw, E.A.; Adams, B.J.; Barrett, J.E.; Lyons, W.B.; Virginia, R.A.; Wall, D.H. Stable C and N isotope ratios reveal soil food web structure and identify the nematode Eudorylaimus antarcticus as an omnivore—predator in Taylor Valley, Antarctica.
Sentence_location: The McMurdo Dry Valleys (MDV) in Victoria Land, Antarctica, compose the largest ice-free area on the continent [6].

Sentence_species: [CrossRef] Shaw, E.A.; Adams, B.J.; Barrett, J.E.; Lyons, W.B.; Virginia, R.A.; Wall, D.H. Stable C and N isotope ratios reveal soil food web structure and identify the nematode Eudorylaimus antarcticus as an omnivore—predator in Taylor Valley, Antarctica.
Sentence_location: Recent evidence showed that E. antarcticus occupied the omnivore-predator trophic level in Taylor Valley [35]; the presence of multiple trophic levels—from microbes and microbivores to omnivore-predators—indicates that biotic interactions existed in the MDV.

Sentence_species: [CrossRef] Shaw, E.A.; Adams, B.J.; Barrett, J.E.; Lyons, W.B.; Virginia, R.A.; Wall, D.H. Stable C and N isotope ratios reveal soil food web structure and identify the nematode Eudorylaimus antarcticus as an omnivore—predator in Taylor Valley, Antarctica.
Sentence_location: We aimed to inoculate Scottnema microcosms with S. lindsayae at abundances of 1000 to 2000 per kg dry soil (125 to 250 per microcosm) based on mean abundances found in Taylor Valley soils [8].

Sentence_species: [CrossRef] Shaw, E.A.; Adams, B.J.; Barrett, J.E.; Lyons, W.B.; Virginia, R.A.; Wall, D.H. Stable C and N isotope ratios reveal soil food web structure and identify the nematode Eudorylaimus antarcticus as an omnivore—predator in Taylor Valley, Antarctica.
Sentence_location: Since very few E. antarcticus were present in the Many Glacier Pond soil, ten bulk soil samples collected from moss beds in 2015 at Hjorth Hill were used for the collection of E. antarcticus for the Eudorylaimus treatment.
